main_definition: Having the necessary skills, knowledge or experience to do something effectively.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Adjective - Lacking a degree of excellence; not fully competent or proficient in a certain area.
meanings_and_examples.example: His claim to expertise was qualified at best, as he had only read about the subject.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Adjective - Sufficiently skilled or educated to perform a particular task or job role effectively.
meanings_and_examples.example: She is a highly qualified teacher with over 10 years of experience in education.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Noun - A person who meets the necessary requirements for a job or professional position, often after an assessment or testing process.
meanings_and_examples.example: The company has received several applications from highly qualified candidates for the managerial role.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Verb (used with object) - To limit or restrict something to certain individuals who meet specific criteria.
meanings_and_examples.example: The scholarship was qualified by requiring applicants to have a minimum GPA of 3.5.
